definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: We will fight, for what she sings of is beautiful and good.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定会投身战斗的，因为她所歌唱的是美与善。

sentences.english: The lawn was shadowed by a linden tree.
sentences.chinese: 椴树的树影投身在草坪上。

sentences.english: In the river on appeal, rengar devoted himself to the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 在江放的感召下，润格积极投身到了革命的事业之中。

sentences.english: Hasa strong commitment to a career in Aviation technology.
sentences.chinese: 有投身航空技术领域的强烈意愿。

sentences.english: He associated himself with a great cause.
sentences.chinese: 他投身于一项伟大的事业。

sentences.english: He was caught up in the anti-fascist movement during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次世界大战期间他投身于反法西斯运动中。

sentences.english: More and more people in China enter upon the campaign of saving rare animals out extinction.
sentences.chinese: 在中国越来越多的人投身于挽救珍稀动物的运动中。

sentences.english: In 1876, Homer abandoned illustration to devote himself to painting.
sentences.chinese: 1876年，霍默放弃插图工作，转而投身绘画。

sentences.english: Those were the people I got into politics for.
sentences.chinese: 就是为了这些人，我才投身于政治。

sentences.english: Leia followed in her adoptive father's footsteps, and entered politics.
sentences.chinese: 莱娅追随着她养父的脚步，投身政治。

sentences.english: She loves her job and devotes herself to it.
sentences.chinese: 她热爱她的工作并投身于它。

sentences.english: I love Englis and hope to devote myself to this career.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢英语，也希望投身于这一事业。

sentences.english: She was caught up in the anti-nuclear movement.
Added to this, three and a half million men and women are directly engaged in the defense establishment.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有三百五十万优秀儿女直接投身于国防力量。

sentences.english: He even devoted his forces in the final battle against the Empire on Endor.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至让自己的部队投身在恩多反抗帝国的最后一战。

sentences.english: Once you settle disputes with coworkers (and you will) then you'll magnificently swing into work mode.
sentences.chinese: 一旦解决与同事的争端，你会很快投身到工作中。

definition: to set foot in/to step into/to become involved for the first time
to fight in one place after another
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
to go for/to engage in/to undertake/to deal with/to handle/to do
to go out to sea/to enter the sea (to swim etc)/(fig.) to take the plunge (e.g. leave a secure job, or enter prostitution etc)
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
